intro: Ribes cuneifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to North America. It belongs to the family Grossulariaceae and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green berries that are typically edible and have a tart flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and streambanks. Ribes cuneifolium plays a role in supporting local wildlife, particularly birds and insects.
